name: Loop Magazine Layout
description: In this project, I created cover art and interior pages for articles of differing content styles, and throughout the project brought a focus to typography and hierarchy.

name: Le Pavot Branding System
description: For the final project in my Typography course, I developed a branding system for an imagined business, from logo and print collateral design to interior and exterior signage design. I started with concept and logo development, set up brand guidelines for color, typography, illustration, and logo usage, and then flowed that system cohesively through each project element.

name: Le Pavot Website
description: I opted to design a multiple-page website for my Web Development course using the same “Le Pavot” concept from my concurrent course, Typography. This project was a demonstration of creating a functional, systematically styled set of pages, particularly through using CSS classes and concise, organized HTML.

name: Michaels Website Re-Design
description: In this project, I re-designed a selected website with an unexpected target audience in mind. I chose the website for the craft store Michaels, and updated the branding system, website organization and content, and functionality to match up with a 26-year-old, artistic and eclectic young woman who's interested in sites like Etsy, crafting with an entrepreneurial mindset, and building community.
